title: Angry voters are rising up to oppose Donald Trump at town hall meetings and Republicans aren't taking it well
text:
News Angry voters are rising up to oppose Donald Trump at town hall meetings and Republicans aren't taking it well Congressmen are seeing huge crowds at usually tame local meetings - and they're angry about a lot of things, including scrapping Obamacare Share Matthew Schoenberger, of New Orleans, shouts a question at Republican U.S. Senator Bill Cassidy during a town hall meeting in Metairie, Louisiana (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Angry voters across the US are descending on local meetings with Congressmen in their thousands to protest against Donald Trump's policies. 
The US Senate and House of Representatives are on recess and Representatives and Senators are heading back to their districts to meet with voters. 
But furious locals are rising up to hold Republican representatives to account - often angrily berating them for supporting Trump on repealing Obamacare, the Muslim ban and the Mexican border wall. 
Using similar tactics to the Tea Party movement in 2009, local meetings across the US have been packed out with people ready to ask questions. (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: REUTERS) 
But some congressmen are so afraid of meeting the angry public, they’re not holding their usual town hall meetings - forcing locals to set up their own and empty-chair them. Some have put up “missing posters” for their representatives and pasted their pictures onto milk cartons. Read More 
Here's what's been happening. The numbers have been astonishing, with thousands turning up to some events And those that didn’t hold a townhall - or were late - got a pretty angry response Donald Trump tweeted yesterday that the ‘so-called angry crowds’ were stuffed with organised activists So this group of citizens held up their IDs to prove they were ‘real people’ Some congressmen are picking people they think are going to give them an easy question. But no. The proposed repeal of Obamacare is one frequent source of anger 
Even the highest ranking senators are getting a mouthful 
This is interesting, because Obamacare was the target for the Tea Party in 2009…just from the other direction And the Muslim ban is making voters angry too But this seven year old absolutely stole the show
